description: Dynatrace RUM uses cookies to correlate user actions with backend performance metrics. You can change the cookie settings here. Learn more about RUM cookies in our [documentation](https://dt-url.net/wmq1pti).

SameSiteCookieAttribute.description: Define if your cookie should be restricted to a first-party or same-site context. Learn more about [SameSite cookies and available values](https://dt-url.net/yds1p8u).

cookiePlacementDomain.description: Specify an alternative domain for cookies set by Dynatrace. Keep in mind that your browser may not allow placement of cookies on certain domains (for example, top-level domains). Before typing a domain name here, confirm that the domain will accept cookies from your browser. For details, see the list of [forbidden top-level domains](https://dt-url.net/9n6b0pfz).
cookiePlacementDomain.displayName: Domain to be used for cookie placement

sameSiteCookieAttribute.description: Define if your cookie should be restricted to a first-party or same-site context. Learn more about [SameSite cookies and available values](https://dt-url.net/yds1p8u).

useSecureCookieAttribute.displayName: Use the Secure cookie attribute for cookies set by Dynatrace
useSecureCookieAttribute.documentation: If your application is only accessible via SSL, you can add the Secure attribute to all cookies set by Dynatrace. This setting prevents the display of warnings from PCI-compliance security scanners. Be aware that with this setting enabled Dynatrace correlation of user actions with server-side web requests is only possible over SSL connections.
